thread.title: Cubs focused on Game 3 of NLCS against deGrom, Mets
thread.title_full: Cubs focused on Game 3 of NLCS against deGrom, Mets

author: JAY COHEN
title: Cubs focused on Game 3 of NLCS against deGrom, Mets
text:
Charles Rex Arbogast Cubs focused on Game 3 of NLCS against deGrom, Mets 
Chicago Cubs manager Joe Maddon, right, talks to Chris Coghlan during a team workout in preparation for Tuesday's Game 3 in baseball's National League Championship Series against the New York Mets, Monday, Oct. 19, 2015, in Chicago. (AP Photo/Charles Rex Arbogast) Charles Rex Arbogast Cubs focused on Game 3 of NLCS against deGrom, Mets 
Chicago Cubs' Kris Bryant, left, plays hacky sack with Jason Hammel and Kyle Schwarber , right, during a team workout in preparation for Tuesday's Game 3 in baseball's National League Championship Series against the New York Mets, Monday, Oct. 19, 2015, in Chicago. (AP Photo/Charles Rex Arbogast) Nam Y. Huh Cubs focused on Game 3 of NLCS against deGrom, Mets 
New York Mets pitcher Jacob deGrom throws during a team workout Monday, Oct. 19, 2015, in preparation for Tuesday's Game 3 in baseball's National League Championship Series against the Chicago Cubs in Chicago. (AP Photo/Nam Y. Huh) Charles Rex Arbogast Cubs focused on Game 3 of NLCS against deGrom, Mets 
New York Mets starting pitcher Jacob deGrom runs Monday, Oct. 19, 2015, during a team workout in preparation for Tuesday's Game 3 in baseball's National League Championship Series against the Chicago Cubs in Chicago. (AP Photo/Charles Rex Arbogast) Nam Y. Huh Cubs focused on Game 3 of NLCS against deGrom, Mets 
Chicago Cubs’ Anthony Rizzo, right, and Kris Bryant arrive at Wrigley Field for a team workout in preparation for Tuesday's Game 3 in baseball's National League Championship Series against the New York Mets, Monday, Oct. 19, 2015, in Chicago. (AP Photo/Nam Y. Huh) Posted: Monday, October 19, 2015 7:33 pm | Updated: 8:01 pm, Mon Oct 19, 2015. Cubs focused on Game 3 of NLCS against deGrom, Mets Associated Press | 
CHICAGO (AP) — Kris Bryant, Kyle Schwarber and Jason Hammel played hacky sack with a baseball, and manager Joe Maddon chatted amiably with his players and staff as he made his way around Wrigley Field on Monday afternoon. 
Down 2-0 to the New York Mets in the NL Championship Series, the Chicago Cubs are sticking with what worked for them during a breakthrough season.
